sn46.13:4.1: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.
sn46.13:4.3: In the same way, for a mendicant rational focus is the forerunner and precursor of the arising of the seven awakening factors.
sn46.13:4.5: A mendicant accomplished in rational focus can expect to
sn46.13:4.6: develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors.
sn46.13:5.1: And how does a mendicant with rational focus develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors?
sn46.13:5.2: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and
sn46.13:5.3: equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.13:5.4: That’s how a mendicant with rational focus develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors.”
